sorular.soru: What is the alcohol limit for a new driver?

feedback.metin: Anyone who obtains a driving licence for the first time is a new driver. After obtaining your first driving licence you will be a new driver for 5 years. Different rules apply to new drivers. One of these is a lower alcohol limit of 0.2 per mille blood. For normal drivers, this is 0.5 per mille blood.

sorular.soru: Which part of the road is referred to as the carriageway?

feedback.metin: A carriageway is a part of the road designated for vehicles, with the exception of moped and cycle paths. Cycle lanes do form a component of the carriageway.

sorular.soru: What happens to the braking distance when you drive a caravan?

feedback.metin: If you are driving a caravan, you have to bring more weight to a standstill. More weight means a longer braking distance and therefore a greater stopping distance. Despite the fact that a larger caravan is often braked, this brake is only applied when the vehicle brakes the caravan. With a caravan, there is always more forward force on the vehicle when braking, so the braking distance will be longer.

sorular.soru: How should you secure this load?

feedback.metin: Securing a load is only necessary if the load may fall from or out of the trailer or be blown off. If you cannot secure a load with straps or a rope, you must use a net or tarp. Loads that consist of large parts can usually be secured with a rope or lashing straps. Loads that consist of smaller parts are often best covered with a net. Loads that can be blown off the trailer must be covered with a tarp. Of course, you can also use a combination of methods to secure a load.

sorular.soru: Do seat belts still offer adequate protection if you are wearing a thick winter coat?

feedback.metin: Seat belts do not work as well when you are wearing a thick winter coat. Excess air between the layers of your clothing means the belt cannot sit tightly across your torso. Before the belt protects you in the event of an accident, your body must pass through those layers of air, which increases the risk of your head making contact with the steering wheel or windscreen. To prevent this, ensure a comfortable temperature inside your vehicle and take off your winter coat before driving.

sorular.soru: Should mopeds use the cycle lane?

feedback.metin: Mopeds should use the cycle/moped path, and if neither is present they should use the carriageway. Cycle lanes may only be used by cyclists, snorfietsen, and disabled vehicles. Mopeds must use the carriageway here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drop off passengers here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to drive, park, or stop on a bus lane. This lane may only be used by public buses.

sorular.soru: What should you do if your vehicle is no longer drivable after an accident on a motorway?
cevaplar: Call breakdown assistance and warn traffic.
Try to push the vehicle to the hard shoulder.
Get behind the crash barrier as quickly as possible and call 112.
sorular.dogruCevap: Get behind the crash barrier as quickly as possible and call 112.

feedback.metin: If you are unable to continue your journey due to an accident and your vehicle is stationary on the motorway, you should get yourself to safety first. Leave any injured passengers in the car and get behind the crash barrier as soon as possible. Call 112 and explain where you are and what has happened. The road will be closed immediately, and emergency services will be advised. Do not distract the other traffic and do not warn other traffic. Do not try to push the vehicle to the emergency lane, as this is dangerous.

sorular.soru: When is the best time to measure tyre pressure?

feedback.metin: Tyre pressure must be measured before you drive. This gives an exact picture of the correct tyre pressure.

sorular.soru: Which following distance qualifies as tailgating?

feedback.metin: Tailgating is driving behind another vehicle at such a short distance that a collision is unavoidable if the vehicle in front of you has to make an emergency stop. The majority of all rear-end collisions are the result of tailgating. Tailgating is defined as a following distance of less than two seconds.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Keep driving and refill the windscreen washer fluid at home.
Stop immediately and check the coolant level.
Stop immediately and check the oil level.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately and check the coolant level.

feedback.metin: This light is indicating that the engine temperature is too high, which means there is something wrong with the engine’s cooling system. Pull over and park on the side of the road as soon as possible and check the coolant level. If the vehicle is overheating, call the breakdown service.

sorular.soru: Is the trailer correctly attached?

feedback.metin: The break-away system’s cable must be attached to a designated hook or eye. That is not the case here, which means the trailer is not properly attached.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to answer a phone call?

feedback.metin: Hard shoulders and lay-bys can only be used in emergency situations. Stopping to answer a phone call is not an emergency situation.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake on the right here?

feedback.metin: Driving over a cycle lane with a solid line is prohibited. You cannot use this lane to overtake the vehicle preparing to turn left.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this, if the load does not interfere with shifting gears and steering?

feedback.metin: Because of the load, you do not have a clear view of your right wing mirror. Load may not obstruct the view in the wing mirrors. You also cannot check your blind spot on the right side this way. Driving like this is therefore not allowed.

sorular.soru: Can you keep driving here if you want to go straight on?
cevaplar: Yes. You can use both lanes to continue straight on.
No. You are only allowed to drive on the left if this improves the flow of traffic.
No. You must use the right lane to continue straight on.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. You can use both lanes to continue straight on.

feedback.metin: Keeping to the right is not mandatory when approaching or driving around roundabouts. This means you can use whichever lane you want, regardless of how busy the road is.

sorular.soru: How can you avoid being blinded by traffic behind you?
cevaplar: By lightly tapping your brake pedal.
By turning on your hazard lights.
By setting the rearview mirror to night mode.
sorular.dogruCevap: By setting the rearview mirror to night mode.

feedback.metin: Rearview mirrors have a night mode, which can be enabled via a button on the underside of the mirror. In night mode, the rearview mirror will not reflect images through its surface, but through the glass. This reduces the amount of light coming through, so you will not be blinded.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to occasionally transport a child without a seat belt in your passenger car?
cevaplar: Yes. But only if the child is taller than 1.35 metres.
Yes. But only if there are more children than seat belts in the back seat.

feedback.metin: All persons you transport in a passenger car must sit in a designated seat and wear a seat belt. There are no exceptions for children's parties or other occasional situations. Not even when the child is taller than 1.35 metres or if more children are to be taken along than there are seat belts. In that case, you are obligated to arrange something else. Transporting children in the boot is also prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are customs officers authorised to check your documents?

feedback.metin: Customs and police officers have the authority to check your documents and vehicle. Customs officers are also authorised to check whether you are using the correct fuel for your vehicle. Compliance with these checks is mandatory.

sorular.soru: When does a three-way catalytic converter work optimally?

feedback.metin: Three-way catalytic converters reduce emissions of carbon monoxide, hydrocarbons, and nitrogen oxide. Catalytic converters only start when the engine is at the right temperature and will therefore only function optimally on longer journeys. With a warm engine, a three-way catalytic converter is capable of removing 90% of harmful exhaust substances.

sorular.soru: Can you drive if this warning light comes on?

feedback.metin: This light means there is a problem with the anti-lock braking system (ABS). You cannot drive with a faulty ABS.

sorular.soru: In which scenario does the cyclist have right of way over you?

feedback.metin: While road signs take precedence over traffic rules, this is only true for traffic rules that apply to exactly the same situation. The priority triangles indicate that you should give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road. However, the cyclist is travelling on the same road as you. The presence of priority triangles is not relevant. The ‘through traffic has priority over traffic turning off the same road’ remains valid here, which is why the cyclist has right of way over you in both scenarios.

sorular.soru: When should a vehicle that runs on petrol or alcohol be inspected for the first time?
cevaplar: 1 year after the first admission date.
3 years after the first admission date.
4 years after the first admission date.
sorular.dogruCevap: 4 years after the first admission date.

feedback.metin: New vehicles that run on petrol, alcohol, or an electric motor must undergo their first APK (General Periodic Inspection) 4 years after the initial admission date, then every two years for two inspections and then every year.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit after this combination of signs?

feedback.metin: A bicycle street is a street that is laid out as a bicycle route, with the goal of making bicycle traffic safer. However, this combination of signs holds no legal weight and there are no deviating traffic rules. This means the speed limit for motorists here is 50 km/h, which – although permitted by law – is clearly not the intention. This is why most bicycle streets have a 30 km/h zone sign. However, this is not always the case.

sorular.soru: After which sign should you expect a bend to the left?

feedback.metin: Sign A warns of a bend to the left. Sign B warns of a double bend, which in this case has a bend to the left first, and then a bend to the right. You should therefore expect a bend to the left after both signs.

sorular.soru: Can you park like this for a short amount of time?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park your vehicle on the road next to another vehicle; this is referred to as double parking. You may, however, briefly stop to load or unload goods or to pick up or drop off passengers. These are not categorised as parking.

sorular.soru: Which vehicles have green number plates?

feedback.metin: The green number plate is used by car dealers for the vehicles they have in stock. It is attached over the yellow number plate as soon as the car has to be transported to or from the site, or during test drives.

sorular.soru: Can you use rear fog lights when driving in bright sunlight to make yourself more visible?

feedback.metin: Rear fog lights may only be used in case of fog or snowfall when visibility is less than 50 metres. In all other cases, the use of rear fog lights is prohibited as it may blind drivers behind you.

sorular.soru: Who should you give way to when reversing out of a corner?

feedback.metin: Reversing around a bend is a special manoeuvre. You must give way to all road users.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way here?

feedback.metin: Priority triangles road markings and the B-6 sign both indicate that you are required to give right of way to all drivers on the intersecting road. In this case, you must therefore give right of way to all drivers on the roundabout.

sorular.soru: Are you overtaking the cyclist safely?

feedback.metin: Bicycles, like mopeds, snorfietsen, and motorcycles, are 2-wheel vehicles. This type of vehicle tends to drift to the sides of the road. When overtaking these vehicles, you must therefore always maintain a safe and spacious lateral passing distance of at least one to one and a half metres. If this is not possible, the best option is to wait for a safe opportunity to overtake.

sorular.soru: Who is responsible for the technical condition of the car?
cevaplar: The car dealer where you bought the car.
The driver and the owner of the car.
sorular.dogruCevap: The driver and the owner of the car.

feedback.metin: If you are driving a car, a moped or even a bicycle, it must meet the legal technical requirements. Both the owner and the driver are responsible for the technical condition of the vehicle.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: The E-1 sign means you are not allowed to park on this side of the road. However, the sign underneath indicates that this only applies to lorries, so you may park here.

sorular.soru: What colour should the rear lights emit?

feedback.metin: The rear lights must emit red light.

sorular.soru: Which vehicles are you allowed to drive after receiving a disqualification from driving?
cevaplar: No vehicles, not even a bicycle.

feedback.metin: If you have been disqualified from driving, you are prohibited from driving motor carriages. This means that it is prohibited to take driving lessons while being disqualified from driving. Both snorfietsen as mopeds qualify as motor carriages. A bicycle is not a motor carriage. Therefore, you are only allowed to ride a bicycle.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here?

feedback.metin: This is an ordinary road outside built-up areas, which means you can travel at 80 km/h unless a different speed limit is indicated on signage.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the red car here?

feedback.metin: The driver of the red car is reversing out of the parking space and should give way to all other traffic. So they should give way to you. You are not obligated to wait. However, do make sure that the driver has seen you and stops in time.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to pick up a passenger?

feedback.metin: You may not stop at an intersection, on a level crossing, in a tunnel, on a cycle lane, or the carriageway next to a cycle lane. Stopping here to pick up a passenger is therefore prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane?

feedback.metin: This lane can only be used by bus drivers, so you cannot drive here.

sorular.soru: What should you do?
cevaplar: Slow down and let the bus go ahead.

feedback.metin: The rule that says you must give way to buses indicating that they want to leave a bus stop only applies in built-up areas. The bus indicates here that passengers are still boarding or alighting at the stop. Therefore, you may proceed cautiously, but keep an eye out for passengers who may suddenly cross in front or behind the bus.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: The C-18 sign indicates that this road is closed to vehicles wider than 2.6 metres, including load. The maximum width of a passenger car is 2.55 metres, so you can drive here.

sorular.soru: Does the speed limit indicated by roadside signs end after these matrix signs?

feedback.metin: The electronic matrix signs indicate the end of any bans previously indicated on electronic matrix signs, which means this ‘end’ does not apply to a speed limit indicated by other signs.

sorular.soru: Can a brommobiel park on the pavement?
cevaplar: Yes. This is allowed if it does not inconvenience others.
This is only allowed if there is no space on the carriageway.

feedback.metin: Brommobielen are not subject to the same rules as mopeds. They are subject to the rules applicable to motor vehicles, which means that – unlike mopeds – they cannot be parked on the pavement. Brommobielen must be parked on the carriageway, like other motor vehicles.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to pick up or drop off a passenger?

feedback.metin: Drivers are not allowed to park their vehicle on the carriageway of a priority road outside built-up areas. Stopping to pick up or drop off passengers is allowed. Of course, this only applies if the traffic situation allows it and you drive away immediately after pick-up or drop-off. Stopping at the intersection is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Who is the driver during a driving lesson?
cevaplar: The person receiving the driving lesson.
The driving instructor giving the lesson.
The person receiving the driving lesson and the driving instructor.
sorular.dogruCevap: The person receiving the driving lesson and the driving instructor.

feedback.metin: You are the driver of a motor carriage if you are driving the motor carriage, but also if a vehicle is being driven under your supervision. According to the law, a number of people are allowed to drive motor carriages under their supervision, such as a driving instructor or driving examiner.
